intro: Palicourea chlorobotrya, commonly known as the green-stemmed palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
